name: list_tools
description: Unified tool listing with multiple modes for different use cases. Supports listing tool names, basic info, categories, grouped by category, summary info, or custom fields. Replaces the previous separate list tools (list_tool_names, list_categories, list_tools_by_category, list_tools_basic, list_tools_by_fields, list_available_tooluniverse_tools).
use_case: List and explore tools with flexible output formats. Use different modes based on your needs: 'names' for quick scanning, 'basic' for name+description, 'categories' for category overview, 'by_category' for grouped listing, 'summary' for detailed overview, or 'custom' for specific fields.
workflow_hint: Start with mode='names' or mode='categories' to get overview, then use mode='basic' or mode='summary' for more details. Use mode='custom' when you need specific fields only.

mode.description: Output mode: 'names' (tool names only), 'basic' (name+description), 'categories' (category statistics), 'by_category' (grouped by category), 'summary' (name+description+type+has_parameters), 'custom' (user-specified fields)

categories.description: Optional list of tool categories to filter by (applies to all modes except 'categories')

fields.description: Required for mode='custom'. List of fields to include (e.g., ["name", "type", "category"])

group_by_category.description: Whether to group results by category (only for mode='names', 'basic', or 'summary')

brief.description: Whether to truncate description to brief (only for mode='basic' or 'summary')

limit.description: Maximum number of tools to return (optional, for pagination)

offset.description: Number of tools to skip (optional, for pagination, default: 0)

return_schema.description: Tool listing results. Format varies by mode: 'names' returns {total_tools, limit, offset, has_more, tools: string[]}, 'basic' returns {total_tools, limit, offset, has_more, tools: [{name, description}]}, 'categories' returns {categories: {category: count}}, 'by_category' returns {total_tools, limit, offset, has_more, tools_by_category: {category: [tool_names]}}, 'summary' returns {total_tools, limit, offset, has_more, tools: [{name, description, type, has_parameters}]}, 'custom' returns {total_tools, limit, offset, has_more, tools: [...]}.

has_more.description: Whether there are more results available

tools.description: List of tools (format depends on mode)

tools_by_category.description: Tools grouped by category (when group_by_category=true or mode='by_category')

test_examples.description: Get summary info (name, description, type, has_parameters)
Get custom fields for tools in specific categories

name: grep_tools
description: Search tools using simple text matching or regex patterns. Supports both simple text search (default, agent-friendly) and regex patterns (advanced). Independent from Tool_Finder_Keyword, uses basic text/regex matching without TF-IDF or NLP processing. Fast and simple for pattern searches.
use_case: Quick text-based search when you know keywords or patterns to search for
workflow_hint: Use with search_mode='text' (default) for simple searches, or 'regex' for advanced pattern matching. For natural language queries, use find_tools instead.

pattern.description: Search pattern (text or regex depending on search_mode)

field.description: Field to search in: name, description, type, or category

search_mode.description: Search mode: 'text' for simple case-insensitive text matching (default, agent-friendly), 'regex' for regex pattern matching

limit.description: Maximum number of tools to return (default: 100)

offset.description: Number of tools to skip (optional, for pagination, default: 0)

categories.description: Optional list of tool categories to filter by

return_schema.description: Search results containing matching tools with pagination metadata

has_more.description: Whether there are more results available

search_mode.description: The search mode used (text or regex)

test_examples.description: Simple text search for 'protein' in tool names
Regex search for tools starting with 'UniProt'

name: get_tool_info
description: Get tool information with configurable detail level. Supports single tool (string) or multiple tools (list). Use detail_level='description' to get only the description field, or detail_level='full' to get complete tool definition including parameter schema.
use_case: Get tool information when you need either just the description or the full definition. Supports both single and batch queries.
workflow_hint: Use detail_level='description' for quick overviews, detail_level='full' when you need complete parameter details. Can query single tool (string) or multiple tools (list, max 20).

tool_names.description: Single tool name (string) or list of tool names (max 20 tools)

detail_level.description: Detail level: 'description' returns only the description field (complete, not truncated), 'full' returns complete tool definition including parameter schema

return_schema.description: Tool information. For single tool query, returns the tool info directly. For batch query, returns an object with total_requested, total_found, and tools array.

test_examples.description: Get description for a single tool
Get full definition for a single tool

name: execute_tool
description: Execute a ToolUniverse tool directly with custom arguments. This is the primary way to run any tool in the ToolUniverse system.
use_case: Execute any ToolUniverse tool by name with custom arguments. Use after discovering tools via find_tools or list_tools.
workflow_hint: First use find_tools or list_tools to discover available tools, then use execute_tool to run them with your specific parameters.

tool_name.description: Name of the tool to execute (e.g., 'example_tool_name')

arguments.description: Tool arguments as a JSON object (dictionary), NOT a JSON string. Pass the parameters required by the target tool as key-value pairs. Example: {"param1": "value1", "param2": 5}. Do NOT use string format like 'param1=value1' or '"{\"param1\":\"value1\"}"'. Must be a proper JSON object.

return_schema.description: Tool execution result as a structured object (dict). The actual content depends on the executed tool. May contain error information if execution failed. Returns structured data instead of JSON string for programmatic use.

test_examples.description: Execute a tool with multiple arguments
